intro: Pteroselinum alsaticum, commonly known as Italian parsley, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are often used as a garnish or flavoring in cooking. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Pteroselinum alsaticum is native to the Mediterranean region and is widely cultivated for its aromatic foliage and culinary uses.
